content.text: I have big plans for the weekend! On Saturday, I <highlight>'m going to visit</highlight> my parents. We <highlight>are going to have</highlight> lunch together. In the afternoon, I <highlight>'m going to go</highlight> shopping. I <highlight>'m going to buy</highlight> a new dress for the party next week. On Sunday, my friends <highlight>are going to come</highlight> over. We <highlight>are going to watch</highlight> a movie. Look at those clouds! It <highlight>'s going to rain</highlight>!
content.question: When do we use 'going to'? What's the difference from 'will'?
content.question_ru: Когда мы используем 'going to'? В чём отличие от 'will'?

theory.title: Going to - Plans and predictions with evidence
theory.title_ru: Going to - Планы и предсказания с доказательствами

points.example: I am going to travel. She is going to study.
I'm going to buy a car next month. (I already decided)
Look at those clouds! It's going to rain. (I can see evidence)
I'm not going to go. She isn't going to come.

comparison_table.example: I'm going to visit Paris. (already planned)

notice.instruction: Find all 'going to' structures. Identify: plan or prediction with evidence?
notice.instruction_ru: Найди все структуры 'going to'. Определи: план или предсказание с доказательством?

tasks.text: A: What are you going to do this weekend? B: I'm going to visit my grandmother. She's going to cook dinner for us. A: That sounds nice! Look at your brother - he's going to fall off that chair! B: Oh no! Be careful! A: Are you going to stay long at your grandmother's? B: Yes, we're going to stay until Sunday. I'm not going to take my laptop though.

produce.instruction: Write about your plans for next weekend.
produce.instruction_ru: Напиши о своих планах на следующие выходные.
prompts: What are you going to do on Saturday morning?
Who are you going to meet?
Where are you going to go?
What are you going to eat?
What are you NOT going to do?
produce.example: Next weekend is going to be busy! On Saturday, I'm going to wake up early. I'm going to go to the gym. Then I'm going to meet my friend for coffee. We're going to have lunch at a new restaurant. On Sunday, I'm going to stay home. I'm going to clean my apartment. I'm not going to work at all!

input_flood.description: Read 5 texts with many 'going to' structures.

texts.title: Vacation Plans
texts.content: Next month, we're going to go to Greece! We're going to stay in Athens for three days. We're going to visit the Acropolis. Then we're going to travel to the islands. We're going to swim in the sea every day. I'm going to take many photos. My husband is going to try Greek food. We're not going to think about work at all!

texts.title: Birthday Party
texts.content: I'm going to have a birthday party next Saturday! I'm going to invite 20 friends. My mom is going to bake a cake. My dad is going to set up the music. We're going to dance all night. I'm not going to cook - we're going to order pizza. Are you going to come? It's going to be amazing!

texts.title: New Year Plans
texts.content: Next year is going to be different! I'm going to change my life. I'm going to exercise every day. I'm going to eat healthy food. I'm not going to waste time on social media. I'm going to read more books. My family is going to travel together. We're going to visit Japan. It's going to be the best year ever!

texts.title: Weather Warning
texts.content: Look outside! It's going to be a terrible storm. Look at those dark clouds - it's going to rain heavily. The wind is going to be very strong. We're not going to go outside today. We're going to stay home. I'm going to close all the windows. The roads are going to be dangerous.

texts.title: Career Plans
texts.content: After university, I'm going to look for a job in marketing. I'm going to apply to big companies. I'm not going to give up easily. My professor is going to write a recommendation letter. I'm going to prepare for interviews. It's going to be challenging, but I'm ready. One day, I'm going to start my own business!

grammar_cards.back:
'm going to visit

Planned before = going to

grammar_cards.front:
Look at those clouds! It ___.
(will rain / 's going to rain)
grammar_cards.back:
's going to rain

Evidence (clouds) = going to

grammar_cards.front:
I've decided. I ___ a car.
(will buy / 'm going to buy)
grammar_cards.back:
'm going to buy

Already decided = going to
